TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TableItemPattern extends System.Windows.Automation.GridItemPattern

Docs.summary: Represents the child controls of containers that support .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This control pattern is analogous to <xref:System.Windows.Automation.GridItemPattern> with the distinction that any control supporting <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TableItemPattern> will programmatically expose the relationship between the individual cell and its row and column information.
Access to individual cell functionality is provided by the additional support of <xref:System.Windows.Automation.GridItemPattern>.

Docs.summary: Gets the cached property values for this .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Cached property values must have been previously requested using a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.CacheRequest>. To get the current value of a property, get the property by using <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TableItemPattern.Current%2A>.
For information on the properties available and their use, see <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TableItemPattern.TableItemPatternInformation>.

Docs.exception: The requested property is not in the cache.

Docs.summary: Identifies the property that retrieves all the column headers associated with a table item or cell.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications. UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TableItemPatternIdentifiers>.
This property is not present in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TableItemPattern.TableItemPatternInformation> and must be retrieved by using <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.GetCurrentPropertyValue%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.GetCachedPropertyValue%2A>.
## Examples In the following example, an array of automation element objects representing the primary row or column header items of a table is retrieved.
For the purposes of this example, a relationship between the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TablePattern.TablePatternInformation.RowOrColumnMajor%2A> property and the row and column header items is demonstrated. However, a table can have row and column headers regardless of the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TablePattern.TablePatternInformation.RowOrColumnMajor%2A> property of the table.
[!code-csharp[UIATableItemPattern_snip#105](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATableItemPattern_snip/CSharp/UIATableItemPattern_snippets.cs#105)] [!code-vb[UIATableItemPattern_snip#105](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATableItemPattern_snip/VisualBasic/UIATableItemPattern_snippets.vb#105)]

Docs.summary: Gets the current property values for this .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This pattern must be from an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> with an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElementMode.Full> reference in order to get current values. If the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> was obtained using <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElementMode.None>, it contains only cached data, and attempting to get the current value of any property raises an exception. Use <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TableItemPattern.Cached%2A> to get the cached value of a property that was previously specified using a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.CacheRequest>.
For information on the properties available and their use, see <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TableItemPattern.TableItemPatternInformation>.

## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications. UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TableItemPatternIdentifiers>.
The pattern identifier is passed to methods such as <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.GetCurrentPattern%2A> to retrieve the control pattern of interest from the specified <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement>.
## Examples In the following example, a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TableItemPattern> control pattern is obtained from an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement>.
[!code-csharp[UIATableItemPattern_snip#101](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATableItemPattern_snip/CSharp/UIATableItemPattern_snippets.cs#101)] [!code-vb[UIATableItemPattern_snip#101](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATableItemPattern_snip/VisualBasic/UIATableItemPattern_snippets.vb#101)]

Docs.summary: Identifies the property that retrieves all the row headers associated with a table item or cell.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications. UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TableItemPatternIdentifiers>.
This property is not present in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TableItemPattern.TableItemPatternInformation> and must be retrieved by using <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.GetCurrentPropertyValue%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.GetCachedPropertyValue%2A>.
## Examples In the following example, an array of automation element objects representing the primary row or column header items of a table is retrieved.
For the purposes of this example, a relationship between the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TablePattern.TablePatternInformation.RowOrColumnMajor%2A> property and the row and column header items is demonstrated. However, a table can have row and column headers regardless of the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TablePattern.TablePatternInformation.RowOrColumnMajor%2A> property of the table.
